title: BBC's Nick Robinson compares Boris Johnson's People's PMQs to 'propaganda used by dictators down the ages'
text:
Nick Robinson has described Boris Johnson’s social media operation as “a form of propaganda used by dictators down the ages” because it does not allow for proper scrutiny.

The BBC broadcaster complained that the Prime Minister’s use of Facebook and Twitter to communicate his messages was not democratic, and that there is no opportunity to hold him to account on the platforms.

The comments sparked a robust reaction from MPs, with one Senior Government source telling The Telegraph: “It would, quite frankly, be bizarre not to use social media to talk directly to people - and we will continue to do so despite criticisms from people who may be a little out of touch with modern media.”
